name: THE SENTRY OF ANDUIN  (Rogue 33/ Fighter 6/ Shadowdancer 1)
author: Valerfor

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Here is a build that i thought for the little folks, although i am hardly an expert in Thief builds, i tried my best to make a character that had the most rogue lvls i could fit in, while he still get the four attacks schedule and EWS from a little fighter training. This should be very playable from start to finish.
Anduin was the first land (valley) that Hobbits were inhabited. Surrounded by enemies they had to have some really valiant guards to survive. So this is one of these guards, their best actually as I would like to think. He is a classic sneaker but he uses a shield and relies to fighter's training to enhance his damage. The elimination of multiple weapon's fighting allows him to be much better with his selected sword. He gains fighter combat feats, more hit points and better armor class than a dual-wielding rogue. This while he maintains a formidable offense with 20 dice of sneak attack & the notorius crippling strike! He can generate his own sneaks very easily too without darkness wands or flanking, by forcing his foes to sit (IKD) on their back ends. If those are not enough, he can set Epic traps and can craft his own deadly ones. I think that a 43 AB with 33 Rogue lvls is pretty good as well.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
OK, the IC it is. That much SA makes crits redundant. If the creature isn't immune to sneaks, it's going to die from them, they are your main source of damage AND they don't multiply on crits. If they are immune to sneaks, they're also immune to crits, so it's a win/win situation

Take it EZ!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
This is a reliable and fun combo. 

I played a DW kukri ftr/CoT version similar to this without SD due to the server nerf (quite common nerf for SD) and less focused on sneak damage.  Your main problems will be dragons, battle horrors and caster mobs that are always pre-buffed with True Seeing.  That's where your trap-stacking technique pays off.  Kiting deadly negative stacks vs. dragons is almost unfair. I always play dexers in robes but with fighter, the armor selection is wide open.

Collect Darkness scrolls to make sneak damage so much more effective against most mobs.

A small tweak to skills...

Slide 2 points from UMD (33 is the scroll target) and 1 from Search (42 will spot all epics immediately) into Craft Trap.  That skill is a d20 roll so the higher you can raise it the less wasted components attempting to craft deadly versions.  DC 35 (DC 45 for gas) is your target so current level 25 will need at least a roll of 10 (about 50% success) to craft deadly.  I seldom craft gas myself.  At this level, you'd craft 1 out of 20 attempts.  Also handy are Fox pots and as much +INT gear as possible while crafting, as an alternative to directing skill boost from items (I remember WoG had some thief gear that boosted trap crafting but this property is generally rare on mid-magic realms).  If your party has a bard 6 or higher, be sure to craft while listening to the concert.

And I know the tune is becoming monotonous... but please furnish an allotment schedule.  Especially for skill-intensive builds like this a new player without access or familiarity with Excel would be severely challenged to duplicate the effort you have already put forth to achieve your goals.  Thanks, mate!
